Hi Jennifer,

Thanks Vikki.

Here is a guide to add user:

  1. Log in to your Stripe Dashboard:
    https://dashboard.stripe.com
  2. Click the Settings (gear icon) in the top-right corner.
  3. Under Business Settings, choose Team and security (or simply Team).
  4. Click “+ New member.”
  5. In the email field, enter accounts@wolfiq.com.au
  6. Choose one of the following:
    • Administrator
  7. Click Invite to send the invitation.

Thanks Joel,

I have set up the new account but I am not sure how to add wolf to the account so that you can access.

Vikki

Hi Jennifer,

Thanks everone for looking into this. Upon reviewing the setup, here’s what we’ve identified

Your current Stripe account is already connected to Xero via Stripe’s Connect platform integration. Stripe enforces what’s called a one-to-one connection model for these types of integrations — meaning:
A single Stripe account can only be connected to one platform (like Xero, WooCommerce, or another app) at a time when using Stripe Connect.
Because your existing Stripe account is currently linked to Xero, Stripe blocks any attempts to link the same account to WooCommerce (or other platforms). This is why we’re seeing the “connected to another platform” error when trying to configure the integration.

You can read more about Stripe’s platform connection rules here:
Security, permissions, and access levels when connecting your Stripe account to a third-party platform

What You Need To Do

To proceed, you'll need to create a second Stripe account under your existing login. This is Stripe’s recommended approach for situations like this.
Here’s how:
  1. Log into your Stripe Dashboard: https://dashboard.stripe.com
  2. Click your business name in the top-left corner.
  3. Select “New account” from the dropdown (or use this direct link: https://dashboard.stripe.com/settings/account/new)
  4. Follow the prompts — you can use the same ABN and details, but please choose a different account name (e.g., “WooCommerce Payments”).

Once that’s created, please add accounts@wolfiq.com.au to the new account so we can help connect WooCommerce to Stripe.

Hi Jen,
I'm not aware of anything else either (I don't believe we've ever needed to update/change/touch your stripe account).

[image: Stripe]
<https://59.email.stripe.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fstripe.com/1/010101974619bd26-2a4b9987-321b-4a58-b2a5-6819c4cbdf51-000000/7cyT_OqtIwzM4tPVRqeKsdDxkZf6Je8ncFcIrqNiaLU=408>





Hello,




You are accepting payments with an older version of the WooCommerce Stripe
Payment Gateway. After July 8, the integration you are using will no longer
be supported, which means that essential performance and feature
enhancements will no longer be made to this integration.




Please update to the new Standard Checkout Experience by July 8, 2025 to
access a modern checkout with popular payment methods
<https://woocommerce.com/document/stripe/setup-and-configuration/additional-payment-methods/>
including Link, a wallet built by Stripe.




Make this required change in the WooCommerce Dashboard:





1. Go to WooCommerce > Settings > Payments > Stripe > Settings




2. Scroll down to the Advanced settings section




3. If the “Enable the legacy checkout experience” setting is checked,
uncheck it




4. Click Save changes at the bottom




5. Test the updated changes
<https://woocommerce.com/document/stripe/admin-experience/new-checkout-experience/#appearance>





If you update your plugin after July 8, the Standard Checkout Experience
will be enabled automatically.




For more information about this change, see our support page
<https://woocommerce.com/document/stripe/admin-experience/updated-stripe-checkout-experience-mid-2025/>.
If you have additional questions, please reply to this email and a
Happiness Engineer will be glad to help.




— The Stripe and WooCommerce teams





Stripe emails you about important updates like plugin requirements. If you
no longer use the WooCommerce Stripe Payment Gateway in your site, you can
disregard this email.



This email relates to your Bicknell Law & Consulting
